Emailed: CE data is matches, purpose: CE (+ local storage / disk cache) for VO NOvA, production, Mid-term goal: Continue with processing offsite (non-FNAL) NOvA jobs. Upgrade: Only when there is a security/functionality they need

Left VM, CE DATA: Actually, I'm not entirely sure what the difference is between the two, 
and where that's configured. Could you please remind me? I have no

Purpose:

You mean both ouhep0 and tier2-01? tier2-01 is the gatekeeper of our 
ATLAS Tier2 cluster (OU_OCHEP_SWT2), and ouhep0 of our Tier3 cluster 
(OUHEP_OSG).

Both are Production


They will continue running for the medium term future, but we'll update 
them both soon.

Yes, we'll add HTCondor-CE soon after the holidays, but we don't have 
any immediate plans to remove GRAM, unless we're told we need to.

That depends on the site. OUHEP_ITB is auto-updated immediately after a 
new OSG version comes out, but then again, it's our ITB site, so it's 
not used for production. OUHEP_OSG is also updated somewhat frequently, 
since it's an interactive Tier3 andnot used for critical production. 
OU_OCHEP_SWT2 is our main Tier2 cluster, so we like to keep that as 
stable as possible, and only update that when there are problems or 
security issues, or if we need new features for production running. So I 
guess the answers for three sites would be essentially A, B, and C, 
respectively.
Left VM, See entry above

Left VM, That's the production gatekeeper of OU_OSCER_ATLAS, the OU campus 
supercomputer, which is also used for ATLAS Tier2 production, on an 
opportunistic basis. That's usually kept fairly up to date by the OSCER 
admins.

This gatekeeper will be replaced by a new physical machine soon after 
the holidays, since the current OSCER cluster is currently being 
replaced with a new cluster. We'll keep the hostname the same, though, 
to avoid having to make OIM changes.
